newsitem.title: USA: CBOT March corn down as Tenco, Refco sell.
newsitem.headline: CBOT March corn down as Tenco, Refco sell.

text.p: Volume was thin and selling by Tenco Inc and Refco Inc was tied to a quiet decline in CBOT March corn by midsession, traders said.
"It's just a very dull trade and a lack of news," said Ron Kucha of O'Connor and Co in describing the tone in the corn pit.
Tenco sold three million bushels of March and Refco sold two million March, traders said.
Corn was underpinned by gains in soybeans but pressured by a drop to new contract lows in March wheat and the export picture for corn remained cloudy.
Taiwan and South Korea overnight bought U.S. corn.
Taiwan bought 54,000 tonnes of U.S. corn and South Korea bought 52,500 tonnes of U.S. corn, export sources said.
Small-lot bear spreading boosted deferred contracts. The U.S. Feed Grains Council Tuesday said U.S. corn production will rise modestly to 9.490 billion bushels this year.
Technicians cited first support in March corn at $2.68-1/2 a bushel. The session low was $2.68 as of midsession.The four- and 20-day moving averages were bullish early Tuesday, chartists reported.
At 1135 CST, corn was 1/2 cent per bushel lower to 1-3/4 cents higher, with March down 1/2 at $2.69 cents.
